channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Nordic approach to business builds empowerment, team spirit and engagement. But can you copy it?
item.description: Nordic-headquartered businesses occupy ten spaces on Fortune’s 100 Best Companies to Work For – Europe list, despite their countries constituting unde...

item.title: Wells Fargo was reeling from scandal. Jamie Dimon protégé Charlie Scharf bet his career on saving the 173-year-old bank
item.description: Regulators were circling. The stock was sinking. This is the inside story of how Scharf took the toughest job on Wall Street, and got a legendary corp...

item.title: How the world’s largest call center operator is blending artificial intelligence with emotional intelligence
item.description: Since 2023, Teleperformance has been widely adopting AI across internal and client operations—how is the company keeping its people engaged?

item.title: A Breakthrough Hostage Deal, and an Arrest in Deadly L.A. Wildfire
item.description: Plus, Dolly Parton wants you to know she “ain’t dead yet.”

item.title: Battle over Elon Musk’s trillionaire pay package builds as pension funds face off against Tesla
item.description: Next month, investors will vote on setting Tesla CEO Elon Musk on the path to becoming the world’s first trillionaire.

item.title: China Clamps Down Even Harder on Rare Earth Exports
item.description: The move is Beijing’s latest attempt to tighten control over global production of the metals, which are essential to the manufacture of computer chips...

item.title: Patagonia CEO says climate denialists are delusional: ‘If you step out of a window from the third floor talking about how gravity doesn’t exist, you’re still going to hit the ground’
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: New York Fed’s John Williams Favors More Rate Cuts
item.description: John Williams, president of the Federal Reserve Bank of New York, is primarily concerned with weakness in the labor market.

item.title: Laszlo Krasznahorkai Is Awarded Nobel Prize in Literature
item.description: ​The prize committee said the Hungarian writer’s work “reaffirms the power of art.”

item.title: At the Met’s ‘Divine Egypt,’ the Gods are Eternally Fabulous

item.title: World Leaders Express Hope and Relief After Gaza Deal
item.description: Leaders welcomed the agreement between Israel and Hamas, projecting optimism that an end to the war could be near.

item.title: Why Blowing Up Venezuelan Boats Won’t Stop the Flow of Drugs
